description: Primary part/stock identifier used to reference and locate the item across purchasing, stores, and maintenance.
Code for the warehouse or site where the item is stored.
Specific bin or shelf location within the warehouse for physical storage.
Indicates whether the item is currently active and available for stocking or purchasing.
Detailed storage location path (e.g., aisle/bay/bin) within a warehouse; likely complements bin_no; confirm with SME.
Manufacturer’s model number for the part for cross-reference and purchasing.
Concise item description summarizing the part’s name or function.
Inventory class or commodity code used for categorization, reporting, and possibly accounting controls.
Brand or manufacturer associated with the item.
Inventory unit of measure used for stocking and transactions.
Extended description, notes, and cross-references such as equivalent part numbers or additional specifications.
Identifier for the preferred or current supplier of the item.
Typical supplier lead time to receive the item, measured in days.
Current vendor unit cost used for purchasing and valuation.
Quantity currently on open purchase orders for this item; confirm definition with SME.
Moving average unit cost calculated from purchase history.
Code indicating stocking type (e.g., stocked vs. non-stocked); confirm local code definitions with SME.
Minimum stocking level (reorder point) used to trigger replenishment.
Maximum stocking level target used for replenishment planning.
Total on-hand quantity for the item across its storage locations in the warehouse.
Quantity reserved or committed to work orders, projects, or sales and unavailable for new demand.
Quantity available to allocate, typically on-hand minus reserved quantities.
User-defined text attribute for site-specific information.
User-defined text attribute for site-specific information.
User-defined text attribute for site-specific information.
User-defined text attribute for site-specific information.
User-defined text attribute for site-specific information.
User-defined text attribute for site-specific information.
User-defined numeric attribute for site-specific metrics or thresholds.
User-defined numeric attribute for site-specific metrics or thresholds.
User-defined numeric attribute for site-specific metrics or thresholds.
User-defined numeric attribute for site-specific metrics or thresholds.
User-defined numeric attribute for site-specific metrics or thresholds.
User-defined numeric attribute for site-specific metrics or thresholds.
User-defined date attribute for site-specific timelines or events.
User-defined date attribute for site-specific timelines or events.
User-defined date attribute for site-specific timelines or events.
User-defined date attribute for site-specific timelines or events.
Timestamp of the most recent receipt into stock.
Timestamp of the most recent issue or consumption from stock.
Markup value or percentage applied to cost to derive sell or internal transfer price; confirm basis with SME.
Vendor’s unit of measure as used on purchase documents.
Units per vendor package (e.g., pieces per box or case).
Warranty interval basis (time or usage) for the part; likely defines service or claim frequency; confirm with SME.
Date of the most recent physical or cycle inventory count.
Quantity recorded during the most recent physical or cycle count.
Inventory value recorded during the last count, typically counted quantity multiplied by unit cost.
Minimum sell or charge price used for pricing controls or guidance.
Maximum sell or charge price used for pricing controls or guidance.
Indicates the item is a tool tracked under the tool management program.
Indicates the item is repairable or managed through a repair process; confirm exact usage with SME.
Estimated end-of-life or salvage value used for valuation; confirm business use with SME.
Mileage limit associated with the item’s warranty.
ABC classification indicating inventory importance or turnover for control policies.
Indicates whether individual units require serial number tracking.
General ledger account number used for costing and postings.
Usage or issue quantity for month 1 in a rolling 12‑month history; confirm period mapping with SME.
Usage or issue quantity for month 2 in a rolling 12‑month history; confirm period mapping with SME.
Usage or issue quantity for month 3 in a rolling 12‑month history; confirm period mapping with SME.
Usage or issue quantity for month 4 in a rolling 12‑month history; confirm period mapping with SME.
Usage or issue quantity for month 5 in a rolling 12‑month history; confirm period mapping with SME.
Usage or issue quantity for month 6 in a rolling 12‑month history; confirm period mapping with SME.
Usage or issue quantity for month 7 in a rolling 12‑month history; confirm period mapping with SME.
Usage or issue quantity for month 8 in a rolling 12‑month history; confirm period mapping with SME.
Usage or issue quantity for month 9 in a rolling 12‑month history; confirm period mapping with SME.
Usage or issue quantity for month 10 in a rolling 12‑month history; confirm period mapping with SME.
Usage or issue quantity for month 11 in a rolling 12‑month history; confirm period mapping with SME.
Usage or issue quantity for month 12 in a rolling 12‑month history; confirm period mapping with SME.
Internal key linking the item to a specific vendor–part relationship.
Barcode value used for scanning and item identification.
Identifier linking the inventory item to a corresponding tool asset record.
Flag to exclude this item from automated system catalog updates; confirm governing process with SME.
Expiration date after which the item should not be used or issued.
Serial number associated with an individual unit when serialized tracking applies.
Indicates the item is hazardous material requiring special handling and compliance.
Lot or batch identifier for traceability and quality control.
Core charge value associated with returnable components in automotive parts programs.
Reference to attached documents or images related to the item.
Previous moving average unit cost before the most recent change.
User who created the inventory record.
Timestamp when the inventory record was created.
User who last updated the inventory record.
Timestamp of the most recent update to the inventory record.
Most recent vendor purchase unit cost.
Recorded cost component for the core charge paid to the vendor.
Economic order quantity calculated to minimize total ordering and holding costs.
